channel.title: Stats Chat on Tristan Berchoux
channel.description: Recent content in Stats Chat on Tristan Berchoux

item.title: Sunday Data/Statistics Link Roundup (10/7/12)
item.description: Jack Welch got a little conspiracy-theory crazy with the job numbers. Thomas Lumley over at StatsChat makes a pretty good case for debunking the theory. I think the real take home message of Thomas’ post and one worth celebrating/highlighting is that agencies that produce the jobs report do so based on a fixed and well-defined study design. Careful efforts by government statistics agencies make it hard to fudge/change the numbers.
